HPI 8036 Lancia Delta S4 1986 Tour de Corse H. Toivonen/S. Cresto

This model represents probably the most well-known and infamous of the Group B accidents that spurred the ban of Group B rally cars. Toivonen & Cresto won 12 of the first 17 stages of the rally and held a commanding lead when tragedy struck on stage 18. There were no witnesses to the crash itself so a definitive cause is not known but the result was the death of Toivonen & Cresto. This and 3 other fatalities related to Group B cars compelled the FIA to act and Group B cars were banned for 1987. Audi was the only manufacturer to abandon Group B immediately after Corsica.
